settings.title: Chlamydia treatment
settings.subtitle: Chlamydia is the most common STI in the UK. Treating chlamydia is usually effective with antibiotics. Find our range of medications below.

settings.title: What is Chlamydia?
settings.text: Chlamydia is a very common sexually transmitted disease (STI) that is passed on through unprotected sex. Often the symptoms are not noticeable but can still be spread to partners. The noticeable symptoms usually include pain when urinating, unusual discharge, pain in the stomach or testicles and bleeding after sex and between periods in women.

settings.title: How is chlamydia treated?
settings.text: When taken correctly, antibiotics can be more than 95% effective at treating chlamydia. Antibiotics are usually prescribed after a test has confirmed you have chlamydia. The antibiotics prevent the bacteria from reproducing and stop further infection.

settings.title: of reported cases of Chlamydia in 2018 were accounted for by young people
settings.text: According to NICE, in 2018, chlamydia statistics in the UK showed that 60% of chlamydia cases were due to young people aged between 15-24 years.

settings.title: of chlamydia diagnoses were made through internet testing services
settings.text: According to Public Health England, in 2020, chlamydia testing delivered through internet services rose to 40% which increased the diagnosis from these services from 17% in 2019 to 36% in 2020.

settings.title: Chlamydia Treatment Explained
settings.text: “Chlamydia treatment is typically done with a course of antibiotics. The most common antibiotic used to treat chlamydia is azithromycin, which is taken as a pill. Other antibiotics that can be used include tetracyclines, erythromycin, and levofloxacin. It is important to take all of the medication prescribed to you even if your symptoms go away. If you stop taking your medication too soon, your infection could come back. Make sure to finish the entire course of antibiotics!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: Complete A Quick Online Consultation Form
settings.text: Fill out a quick and simple online consultation form to find out what products you are eligible for.

settings.title: Checkout Securely
settings.text: Once you have completed your consultation and selected your treatment, you can securely checkout online.

settings.title: Express Delivery
settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: How can I tell if I have chlamydia?
settings.text: Often the symptoms of chlamydia are not noticeable. The most common symptoms include pain, a burning sensation while urinating and an abnormal discharge from the penis or vagina.

settings.title: Can chlamydia go away on its own?
settings.text: Untreated chlamydia can lead to long-term complications that may affect your fertility and cause chronic inflammation. It is highly unlikely that chlamydia will go away on its own.

settings.title: What are the male symptoms of chlamydia?
settings.text: Often the symptoms of chlamydia are not noticeable. The most common symptoms include pain, a burning sensation while urinating and an abnormal discharge from the penis or vagina. For men, other symptoms include pain in the lower abdomen or testicles.

settings.title: What are the female symptoms of chlamydia?
settings.text: Often the symptoms of chlamydia are not noticeable. The most common symptoms include pain, a burning sensation while urinating and an abnormal discharge from the penis or vagina. Women may experience pain during sexual intercourse, inflammation of the cervix and bleeding between periods.

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.text: All orders placed before 14:00 from Monday to Friday will be dispatched that day. The orders are sent using 24 Hour Tracked delivery provided by Royal Mail. Items will usually arrive the very next day after the order has been placed. We also provide tracking for your orders to check the status and location of your parcel.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: How is the medication packaged?
settings.text: l our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.
